decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Details, including any relevant drawings, of structural works to the listed building shall be submitted to, and approved by, the Local Planning Authority before any development commences on site.  Such details should include, but not be limited to: Any underpinning, needling of walls or provision of steel support beams; Details of excavation methods (including scale of machinery) and transportation of soil, including details of the size of lorries and frequency of trips to and from the site; Details of any demolition to the existing building; Details of materials to be used for construction works and of waste material (for disposal); Details of heavy machinery storage; Details of hours of construction works; Details of on site storage of materials and equipment.  The construction works shall thereafter be carried out solely in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building, in accordance with policy 4.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Samples of the bricks and tiles to be used in the development and detailed drawings and sections at a scale of 1:20 for all new joinery to be used in the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A schedule of reinstatement works required following structural and building works, including detailed specifications of materials and finishes, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to works commencing.  Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development in accordance with the above specification, or other such details as may be subsequently agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To safeguard the architectural and/or historic interest of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary  Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The basement hereby approved shall be used only as an integral part of the existing dwelling house.  REASON:  To prevent the creation of a separate unit of accommodation on the site in the interests of safeguarding the amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the grilles to cover the light wells shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development.  The grilles shall be installed and maintained solely in accordance with the approved details.  REASON:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
description: Construction of basement with flat glazing at back and side elevation (Listed Building Consent)
